str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Or Mariam of Hebrew origin; Maria or Mariam, the name of six Christian females.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From sun and tereo; to keep closely together, i.e. to conserve; mentally, to remember.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From rheo; an utterance, ; by implication, a matter or topic; with a negative naught whatever.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: From sun and ballo; to combine, i.e. to converse, consult, dispute, to consider, to aid, to join, attack.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
